Detailed Description

Contains the virtual Ackermann drive logic.

Car parameters are hard coded. Commands are assumed to be received from the "/cmd_vel" topic. The controller tries to match the frequency of the velocity command topic and should be capable of > 1kHz.

Warning
The controller uses a speed modifier for car speed translation. This will not match the speed command. This is done for convenient car speed in the simulation. If you need exact velocity commands, please modify the speed_modifier to match the robot's true conversion factor.

Definition at line 25 of file wheel_controller.py.

Member Function Documentation

◆ _calculate_wheel_steering()

def src.wheel_controller.WheelController._calculate_wheel_steering (   self,
  angle 
)
private

Calculates the steering angle of the right and left front wheel.

Angles are computed according to the Ackermann model. Angles are further limited to the maximum steering angle the robot allows for.

Parameters
angleThe desired turning angle for the robot.
Returns
Returns the angles for both front wheels as well as the commanded angle. The initial angle gets modified to the highest achievable angle in case the command violated car constraints.

Definition at line 84 of file wheel_controller.py.

  velocity,
  angle 
)
private

Calculates the rear wheel velocity.

Velocities are computed according to the Ackermann model. Velocities are further limited to the maximum velocity the robot allows for.

Parameters
velocityThe desired velocity for the robot.
angleThe desired turning angle for the robot.
Returns
Returns the velocities for both rear wheels.

◆ _cmd_callback()

def src.wheel_controller.WheelController._cmd_callback (   self,
  twist 
)
private

Callback for the "/cmd_vel" topic subscriber.

Acts as a wrapper to the geometry logic responsible for translating the commands into target values. Publishes to all controllers once calculations are finished.

Parameters
twistTwist message received from the velocity command subscriber.
Note
Velocities will not match the exact command. Uses a simple speed modifier to translate the desired velocity into angular velocity for the joint. Speed modifier is chosen for convenient car speed in the simulation.

Definition at line 61 of file wheel_controller.py.

◆ _limit_angle()

def src.wheel_controller.WheelController._limit_angle (   self,
  lf_angle,
  rf_angle,
  angle 
)
private

Limits the steering angle of the right and left front wheel.

Only modifies the values in case of a violation of the maximum allowable angles.

Parameters
lf_angleThe left front wheel angle computed from the velocity command.
rf_angleThe right front wheel angle computed from the velocity command.
angleThe desired turning angle for the robot.
Returns
Returns the angles for both front wheels as well as the commanded angle. The initial angle gets modified to the highest achievable angle in case the command violated car constraints.

Definition at line 124 of file wheel_controller.py.

  lb_velocity,
  rb_velocity 
)
private

Limits the velocities of the right and left rear wheel.

Only modifies the values in case of a violation of the maximum allowable velocity.

Parameters
lb_velocityThe left rear wheel velocity computed from the velocity command.
rb_velocityThe right rear wheel velocity computed from the velocity command.
Returns
Returns the velocities for both rear wheels.
